text: Found a web-based beautifier this morning that seems to actually work with HubL: <https://ctrlq.org/beautifier/>
Thanks for that, I'm just developing chrome extension for this.
What is that for? is the HubSpot IDE not ok?
just if your indenting / whitespace gets messed up, you can throw your code in there and it'll fix it for you. nice if you inherit code from other devs and just need to get things readable lol
you have prettier on vscode, right?
you can also use shift tab in the design manager
not perfect but works
<@UD53A9UUR> do you have your prettier working with HubL? If so I would love to know your config. It either formats and throws errors or doesn't format and doesnt' throw errros.
prettier working for html/css with hubL*
same question for <@U7SL518D6>. I would imagine you are the man with the insight on this as well
:eyes:
that is still an issue for me :disappointed:
I haven’t really found a great solution to be honest. I just select sections that don’t have HubL and beautify the sections lol
haha fair enough! thanks <@U7SL518D6> and <@UD53A9UUR>

I use a separate beautifier extension in VSCode instead of prettier, which I think looks at your installed languages and changes based on those. never had an issue with Jinja syntax using that, and I don't have to deal with unintended formats on every paste or save or anything like that. that being said, when you're working in the IDE, it's nice to just have a quick solution
What's it called?
<@U26BLKGE4> I second <@UD53A9UUR> questions. Would love to know what extension :slightly_smiling_face:
i am very attached to prettier but hate all these errors more than my love for prettier...
he is keeping it to himself
jerk

Just the standard Beautify plugin, and I was wrong, it doesn't auto-detect languages, but there is an option for enabling handlebar syntax. That combined with the Jinja language extension gives me indenting and highlighting
<https://github.com/HookyQR/VSCodeBeautify>
just hit F1 and then select beautify, works great
Thanks Mark

This is helpful but the problem I'm having in creating the module is everything is stacked.  What I need is a module with a set background image, and then two col text overlay that can be changed as well as a CTA.  When I build this module and add these components, the image is at the top, then the CTA, then the text below that.  How do I get the text blocks and the CTA inside the image block?
